findings.title: Success UI triggered without awaiting network call
findings.why: This ships lies. Users see success even when the request never completed.

evidence.reason: Success UI call in networked flow

fixHints: const res = await fetch(...); if (!res.ok) throw new Error('Request failed');
const data = await res.json(); if (data.success) toast.success('Done!'); else toast.error(data.error);
Use try-catch: try { await api(); toast.success(); } catch (e) { toast.error(e.message); }

findings.title: Optimistic update without rollback on failure
findings.why: State is updated before network call completes, but there's no rollback if the request fails. Users see stale/incorrect data.
fixHints: Add a catch block that reverts the state to previous value on failure.
Use react-query's onMutate/onError for automatic rollback.
Store previous state before update and restore it on error.

findings.title: Catch block swallows error silently
findings.why: Errors are caught but not logged, reported, or shown to users. This makes debugging nearly impossible and hides failures.
fixHints: Add console.error(error) or a logger call.
Show user-friendly error message (toast, alert, etc.).
Re-throw the error if it should propagate.
If intentionally ignoring, add a comment explaining why.

findings.title: Button without onClick handler
findings.why: This button does nothing when clicked. Users expect buttons to perform actions.
fixHints: <Button onClick={() => handleAction()}>Click Me</Button>
For submit: <Button type="submit">Submit</Button>
For disabled: <Button disabled>Coming Soon</Button>

findings.title: Owner mode / env bypass signal detected: packages/isl-adapters/src/github/context.ts
findings.why: This is a production backdoor unless cryptographically gated. It cannot ship.
fixHints: Delete owner mode bypass. If you need dev override, require a signed admin token + non-prod environment.
Add a test that asserts no OWNER_MODE env var grants entitlements.

findings.title: Client references route not found in detected server map: * /api/users/me
findings.why: Route reference didn't match the detected server map. This can be a real missing endpoint or an undetected server route.
fixHints: Closest server routes: GET /api/users (0.87)  POST /api/users (0.87)  DELETE /api/users (0.87)
Matching tried normalization (origin/query/trailing slash/prefix toggles).
If this is a real endpoint, add it server-side or correct the client call.
If this is an external service call, store it as external/allowlisted so it won't be flagged.

findings.title: Client references route not found in detected server map: POST /api/compare
findings.why: Route reference didn't match the detected server map. This can be a real missing endpoint or an undetected server route.
fixHints: No close server route candidates were found (based on static segment similarity).

findings.title: Unmatched client route prefixes (helps fix extraction/allowlists)
findings.why: When one prefix dominates unmatched refs, it usually means server extraction missed a router/plugin prefix or the client is calling a different service.
fixHints: Top unmatched prefixes: api:5
Dominant server prefix inferred: /api
If these should be local, improve route extraction for that prefix (Fastify register(prefix), Next middleware rewrites, basePath, etc.).

findings.title: Env var used but not declared in env templates: AI_ENABLED_ENV
findings.why: Required env var is used with no fallback and not documented. This ships broken installs.
fixHints: Add to .env.example: AI_ENABLED_ENV=your_value_here
Add fallback: const value = process.env.AI_ENABLED_ENV ?? 'default';
Docs: https://12factor.net/config

fixHints: Add to .env.example: OTEL_EXPORTER_OTLP_TIMEOUT=your_value_here
Guard usage: if (process.env.OTEL_EXPORTER_OTLP_TIMEOUT) { /* use it */ }
Docs: https://12factor.net/config

findings.title: Env var used but not declared in env templates: OTEL_EXPORTER_OTLP_TRACES_ENDPOINT
findings.why: Required env var is used with no fallback and not documented. This ships broken installs.
fixHints: Add to .env.example: OTEL_EXPORTER_OTLP_TRACES_ENDPOINT=your_value_here
Add fallback: const value = process.env.OTEL_EXPORTER_OTLP_TRACES_ENDPOINT ?? 'default';
Docs: https://12factor.net/config

findings.title: No .env.example/.env.template found
findings.why: Without an env contract, humans and AI guess env vars and ship broken setups.
fixHints: Add a .env.example listing required/optional vars with comments.

findings.title: Sensitive endpoint appears unprotected: GET /api/users
findings.why: If the server doesn't enforce auth, it's public. UI gating is irrelevant.
fixHints: Next.js: const session = await getServerSession(); if (!session) return NextResponse.json({ error: 'Unauthorized' }, { status: 401 });
Fastify: fastify.addHook('preHandler', async (req, reply) => { if (!req.user) reply.code(401).send({ error: 'Unauthorized' }); });
Or add to middleware.ts matcher: export const config = { matcher: ['/api/admin/:path*'] };
Docs: https://nextjs.org/docs/app/building-your-application/authentication
